page.title: 12SOCIAL CONCERNS PLEAN/COWIE
page.content: The people in this area are represented by a socialist member of parliament and socialist councillors. There are also two community councils in this area. The villages of Plean and Cowie have been designated as socially deprived areas and therefore qualify for Urban Aid funds. Committees have been set up to try to think of projects to improve the quality of life in the two villages. Unemployment in the villages is high. The villagers of Plean have been trying for years to get a community hall. Apart from the Miners' Welfare Hall which is now licensed premises there is nowhere for groups in the village to meet. The playgroup has been looking for accommodation for some time. The Community Council have difficulty in finding a meeting place.
